mxCell.value: Did you deploy the multi-container app to AWS?
Skip this video! Go to the next video
Travis builds a test image, tests code
Travis pushes built prod images to Docker Hub
Travis pushes project to AWS EB
EB pulls images from Docker Hub, deploys
I want to run 4 copies of multi-worker
Kubernetes is a system to deploy containerized apps
Nodes are individual machines (or vm's) that run containers
Masters are machines (or vm's) with a set of programs to manage nodes
To deploy something, we update the desired state of the master with a config file
The master works constantly to meet your desired state
Kubernetes didn't build our images - it got them from somewhere else
Kubernetes (the master) decided where to run each container - each nodecan run a dissimilar set of containers
'Do exactly these steps to arrive at this container setup'
'Our container setup should look like this, make it happen'
Imaginary command to add a container
You have to figure out the current state and customize your update with that state!
I need to update multi-worker to v1.23
kubernetes update container1 container2 container3 container 4 .....
Imaginary command to update a container
You have to figure out the current state and customize your update with that state!
I need to update multi-worker to v1.23
Change config file to specify multi-worker v1.23
Send config file to Kubernetes, master takes care of changes
I don't care about the current state, I'll just tell Kubernetes what I want
Create 3 containers using the multi-worker image
Those 4 number of containers should be networked to multi-redis
There should be 4 containers using multi-worker networked to multi-redis
There should be 4 containers using multi-worker using v1.23 networked to multi-redis
Those 4 number of containers should be updated to use multi-worker v1.23
Create 3 containers using the multi-worker image
There should be 3 containers using multi-worker

There should be 4 containers using multi-worker

Kubernetes has commands to do things this way
Kubernetes also has commands to do things this way
CLI for interacting with our master
Used to make a VM that will be your single node
Runs a single node on that VM

Create a 'deployment' file to deploy the
multi-client image
Send the deployment file to master by using 'kubectl'
